1  true);
205  FEFaceEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi_p(data, /*is_interior_face=*/ false);
206 *
207  for (unsigned int face = range.first; face < range.second; ++face)
208  {
209  phi_m.reinit(face);
210  phi_m.gather_evaluate(src, face_evaluation_flags);
211  phi_p.reinit(face);
212  phi_p.gather_evaluate(src, face_evaluation_flags);
213 *
214  // some operations on the face quadrature points
215 *
216  phi_m.integrate_scatter(face_evaluation_flags, dst);
217  phi_p.integrate_scatter(face_evaluation_flags, dst);
218  }
219  },
220  [&](const auto &data, auto &dst, const auto &src, const auto range) {
221  // operation performed boundary faces
222 *
223  FEFaceEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi_m(data, /*is_interior_face=*/ true);
224 *
225  for (unsigned int face = range.first; face < range.second; ++face)
226  {
227  phi_m.reinit(face);
228  phi_m.gather_evaluate(src, face_evaluation_flags);
229 *
230  // some operations on the face quadrature points
231 *
232  phi_m.integrate_scatter(face_evaluation_flags, dst);
233  }
234  },
235  dst,
236  src);
237 @endcode
238 *
239 * in the following way:
240 * @code
241 matrix_free.template loop_cell_centric<VectorType, VectorType>(
242  [&](const auto &data, auto &dst, const auto &src, const auto range) {
243  FEEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi(data);
244  FEFaceEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi_m(data, /*is_interior_face=*/ true);
245  FEFaceEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi_p(data, /*is_interior_face=*/ false);
246 *
247  for (unsigned int cell = range.first; cell < range.second; ++cell)
248  {
249  phi.reinit(cell);
250  phi.gather_evaluate(src, cell_evaluation_flags);
251 *
252  // some operations on the cell quadrature points
253 *
254  phi.integrate_scatter(cell_evaluation_flags, dst);
255 *
256  // loop over all faces of cell
257  for (unsigned int face = 0; face < GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell; ++face)
258  {
259  if (data.get_faces_by_cells_boundary_id(cell, face)[0] ==
260  numbers::internal_face_boundary_id)
261  {
262  // internal face
263  phi_m.reinit(cell, face);
264  phi_m.gather_evaluate(src, face_evaluation_flags);
265  phi_p.reinit(cell, face);
266  phi_p.gather_evaluate(src, face_evaluation_flags);
267 *
268  // some operations on the face quadrature points
269 *
270  phi_m.integrate_scatter(face_evaluation_flags, dst);
271  }
272  else
273  {
274  // boundary face
275  phi_m.reinit(cell, face);
276  phi_m.gather_evaluate(src, face_evaluation_flags);
277 *
278  // some operations on the face quadrature points
279 *
280  phi_m.integrate_scatter(face_evaluation_flags, dst);
281  }
282  }
283  }
284  },
285  dst,
286  src);
287 @endcode
288 *
289 * It should be noted that FEFaceEvaluation is initialized now with two numbers,the cell number and the local face number. The given example onlyhighlights how to transform face-centric loops into cell-centric loops andis by no means efficient, since data is read and written multiple timesfrom and to the global vector as well as computations are performedredundantly. Below, we will discuss advanced techniques that target these issues.
290 * To be able to use MatrixFree::loop_cell_centric(), following flags of MatrixFree::AdditionalData have to be enabled:
291 * @code
292 typename MatrixFree<dim, Number>::AdditionalData additional_data;
293 *
294 
295 
296 *
297 *
298 additional_data.hold_all_faces_to_owned_cells = true;
299 additional_data.mapping_update_flags_faces_by_cells =
300  additional_data.mapping_update_flags_inner_faces |
301  additional_data.mapping_update_flags_boundary_faces;
302 *
303 data.reinit(mapping, dof_handler, constraint, quadrature, additional_data);
304 @endcode
305 *
306 * In particular, these flags enable that the internal data structures are set upfor all faces of the cells.
307 * Currently, cell-centric loops in deal.II only work for uniformly refined meshesand if no constraints are applied (which is the standard case DG is normallyused).
308 *
309 
310 * <a name="ProvidinglambdastoMatrixFreeloops"></a><h3>Providing lambdas to MatrixFree loops</h3>
311 *
312 
313 * The examples given above have already used lambdas, which have been provided tomatrix-free loops. The following short examples present how to transform functions betweena version where a class and a pointer to one of its methods are used and avariant where lambdas are utilized.
314 * In the following code, a class and a pointer to one of its methods, which shouldbe interpreted as cell integral, are passed to MatrixFree::loop():
315 * @code
316 void
317 local_apply_cell(const MatrixFree<dim, Number> & data,
318  VectorType & dst,
319  const VectorType & src,
320  const std::pair<unsigned int, unsigned int> &range) const
321 {
322  FEEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi(data);
323  for (unsigned int cell = range.first; cell < range.second; ++cell)
324  {
325  phi.reinit(cell);
326  phi.gather_evaluate(src, cell_evaluation_flags);
327 *
328  // some operations on the quadrature points
329 *
330  phi.integrate_scatter(cell_evaluation_flags, dst);
331  }
332 }
333 @endcode
334 *
335 * @code
336 matrix_free.cell_loop(&Operator::local_apply_cell, this, dst, src);
337 @endcode
338 *
339 * However, it is also possible to pass an anonymous function via a lambda functionwith the same result:
340 * @code
341 matrix_free.template cell_loop<VectorType, VectorType>(
342  [&](const auto &data, auto &dst, const auto &src, const auto range) {
343  FEEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, 1, Number> phi(data);
344  for (unsigned int cell = range.first; cell < range.second; ++cell)
345  {
346  phi.reinit(cell);
347  phi.gather_evaluate(src, cell_evaluation_flags);
348 *
349  // some operations on the quadrature points
350 *
351  phi.integrate_scatter(cell_evaluation_flags, dst);
352  }
353  },
354  dst,
355  src);
356 @endcode
357 *
358 * <a name="VectorizedArrayType"></a><h3>VectorizedArrayType</h3>
359 *
360 
361 * The class VectorizedArray<Number> is a key component to achieve the highnode-level performance of the matrix-free algorithms in deal.II.It is a wrapper class around a short vector of @f$n@f$ entries of type Number andmaps arithmetic operations to appropriate single-instruction/multiple-data(SIMD) concepts by intrinsic functions. The length of the vector can bequeried by VectorizedArray::size() and its underlying number type by VectorizedArray::value_type.
362 * In the default case ( <code>VectorizedArray<Number></code> ), the vector length isset at compile time of the library tomatch the highest value supported by the given processor architecture.However, also a second optional template argument can bespecified as <code>VectorizedArray<Number, size></code>, where <code>size</code> explicitlycontrols the vector length within the capabilities of a particular instructionset. A full list of supported vector lengths is presented in the following table:
363 * <table align="center" class="doxtable">
364  <tr>
365  <th>double</th>
366  <th>float</th>
367  <th>ISA</th>
368  </tr>
369  <tr>
370  <td><code>VectorizedArray<double, 1></code></td>
371  <td><code>VectorizedArray<float, 1></code></td>
372  <td>(auto-vectorization)</td>
373  </tr>
374  <tr>
375  <td><code>VectorizedArray<double, 2></code></td>
376  <td><code>VectorizedArray<float, 4></code></td>
377  <td>SSE2/AltiVec</td>
378  </tr>
379  <tr>
380  <td><code>VectorizedArray<double, 4></code></td>
381  <td><code>VectorizedArray<float, 8></code></td>
382  <td>AVX/AVX2</td>
383  </tr>
384  <tr>
385  <td><code>VectorizedArray<double, 8></code></td>
386  <td><code>VectorizedArray<float, 16></code></td>
387  <td>AVX-512</td>
388  </tr>
389 </table>
390 * This allows users to select the vector length/ISA and, as a consequence, thenumber of cells to be processed at once in matrix-free operator evaluations,possibly reducing the pressure on the caches, an severe issue for very highdegrees (and dimensions).
391 * A possible further reason to reduce the number of filled lanesis to simplify debugging: instead of having to look at, e.g., 8cells, one can concentrate on a single cell.
392 * The interface of VectorizedArray also enables the replacement by any type witha matching interface. Specifically, this prepares deal.II for the <code>std::simd</code> class that is planned to become part of the C++23 standard. The following tablecompares the deal.II-specific SIMD classes and the equivalent C++23 classes:
393 *
394 
395 * <table align="center" class="doxtable">
396  <tr>
397  <th>VectorizedArray (deal.II)</th>
398  <th>std::simd (C++23)</th>
399  </tr>
400  <tr>
401  <td><code>VectorizedArray<Number></code></td>
402  <td><code>std::experimental::native_simd<Number></code></td>
403  </tr>
404  <tr>
405  <td><code>VectorizedArray<Number, size></code></td>
406  <td><code>std::experimental::fixed_size_simd<Number, size></code></td>
407  </tr>
408 </table>
409 *
410 
411 * <a name="CommProg"></a> <h1> The commented program</h1>
412 * <a name="Parametersandutilityfunctions"></a> <h3>Parameters and utility functions</h3>
413 *
414 
415 *
416 * The same includes as in @ref step_67 "step-67" :
417 *
418 
419 *
420 * @code
421  #include <deal.II/base/conditional_ostream.h>
422  #include <deal.II/base/function.h>
423  #include <deal.II/base/logstream.h>
424  #include <deal.II/base/time_stepping.h>
425  #include <deal.II/base/timer.h>
426  #include <deal.II/base/utilities.h>
427  #include <deal.II/base/vectorization.h>
428 *
429  #include <deal.II/distributed/tria.h>
430 *
431  #include <deal.II/dofs/dof_handler.h>
432 *
433  #include <deal.II/fe/fe_dgq.h>
434  #include <deal.II/fe/fe_system.h>
435 *
436  #include <deal.II/grid/grid_generator.h>
437  #include <deal.II/grid/tria.h>
438  #include <deal.II/grid/tria_accessor.h>
439  #include <deal.II/grid/tria_iterator.h>
440 *
441  #include <deal.II/lac/affine_constraints.h>
442  #include <deal.II/lac/la_parallel_vector.h>
443 *
444  #include <deal.II/matrix_free/fe_evaluation.h>
445  #include <deal.II/matrix_free/matrix_free.h>
446  #include <deal.II/matrix_free/operators.h>
447 *
448  #include <deal.II/numerics/data_out.h>
449 *
450  #include <fstream>
451  #include <iomanip>
452  #include <iostream>
453 *
454  @endcode
455 *
456 * A new include for categorizing of cells according to their boundary IDs:
457 *
458 
459 *
460 * @code
461  #include <deal.II/matrix_free/tools.h>
462 *
463 
464 *
465  namespace Euler_DG
466  {
467  using namespace dealii;
468 *
469  @endcode
470 *
471 * The same input parameters as in @ref step_67 "step-67" :
472 *
473 
474 *
475 * @code
476  constexpr unsigned int testcase = 1;
477  constexpr unsigned int dimension = 2;
478  constexpr unsigned int n_global_refinements = 2;
479  constexpr unsigned int fe_degree = 5;
480  constexpr unsigned int n_q_points_1d = fe_degree + 2;
481 *
482  @endcode
483 *
484 * This parameter specifies the size of the shared-memory group. Currently, only the values 1 and numbers::invalid_unsigned_int is possible, leading to the options that the memory features can be turned off or all processes having access to the same shared-memory domain are grouped together.
485 *
486 
487 *
488 * @code
489  constexpr unsigned int group_size = numbers::invalid_unsigned_int;
490 *
491  using Number = double;
492 *
493  @endcode
494 *
495 * Here, the type of the data structure is chosen for vectorization. In the default case, VectorizedArray<Number> is used, i.e., the highest instruction-set-architecture extension available on the given hardware with the maximum number of vector lanes is used. However, one might reduce the number of filled lanes, e.g., by writing <code>using VectorizedArrayType = VectorizedArray<Number, 4></code> to only process 4 cells.
496 *
497 
498 *
499 * @code
500  using VectorizedArrayType = VectorizedArray<Number>;
501 *
502  @endcode
503 *
504 * The following parameters have not changed:
505 *
506 
507 *
508 * @code
509  constexpr double gamma = 1.4;
510  constexpr double final_time = testcase == 0 ? 10 : 2.0;
511  constexpr double output_tick = testcase == 0 ? 1 : 0.05;
512 *
513  const double courant_number = 0.15 / std::pow(fe_degree, 1.5);
514 *
515  @endcode
516 *
517 * Specify max number of time steps useful for performance studies.
518 *
519 
520 *
521 * @code
522  constexpr unsigned int max_time_steps = numbers::invalid_unsigned_int;
523 *
524  @endcode
525 *
526 * Runge-Kutta-related functions copied from @ref step_67 "step-67" and slightly modified with the purpose to minimize global vector access:
527 *
528 
529 *
530 * @code
531  enum LowStorageRungeKuttaScheme
532  {
533  stage_3_order_3,
534  stage_5_order_4,
535  stage_7_order_4,
536  stage_9_order_5,
537  };
538  constexpr LowStorageRungeKuttaScheme lsrk_scheme = stage_5_order_4;
539 *
540 
541 *
542  class LowStorageRungeKuttaIntegrator
543  {
544  public:
545  LowStorageRungeKuttaIntegrator(const LowStorageRungeKuttaScheme scheme)
546  {
547  TimeStepping::runge_kutta_method lsrk;
548  switch (scheme)
549  {
550  case stage_3_order_3:
551  lsrk = TimeStepping::LOW_STORAGE_RK_STAGE3_ORDER3;
552  break;
553  case stage_5_order_4:
554  lsrk = TimeStepping::LOW_STORAGE_RK_STAGE5_ORDER4;
555  break;
556  case stage_7_order_4:
557  lsrk = TimeStepping::LOW_STORAGE_RK_STAGE7_ORDER4;
558  break;
559  case stage_9_order_5:
560  lsrk = TimeStepping::LOW_STORAGE_RK_STAGE9_ORDER5;
561  break;
562 *
563  default:
564  AssertThrow(false, ExcNotImplemented());
565  }
566  TimeStepping::LowStorageRungeKutta<
567  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number>>
568  rk_integrator(lsrk);
569  std::vector<double> ci; // not used
570  rk_integrator.get_coefficients(ai, bi, ci);
571  }
572 *
573  unsigned int n_stages() const
574  {
575  return bi.size();
576  }
577 *
578  template <typename VectorType, typename Operator>
579  void perform_time_step(const Operator &pde_operator,
580  const double current_time,
581  const double time_step,
582  VectorType & solution,
583  VectorType & vec_ri,
584  VectorType & vec_ki) const
585  {
586  AssertDimension(ai.size() + 1, bi.size());
587 *
588  vec_ki.swap(solution);
589 *
590  double sum_previous_bi = 0;
591  for (unsigned int stage = 0; stage < bi.size(); ++stage)
592  {
593  const double c_i = stage == 0 ? 0 : sum_previous_bi + ai[stage
594 *
595 - 1];
596 *
597  pde_operator.perform_stage(stage,
598  current_time + c_i time_step,
599  bi[stage] time_step,
600  (stage == bi.size()
601 *
602 - 1 ?
603  0 :
604  ai[stage] time_step),
605  (stage % 2 == 0 ? vec_ki : vec_ri),
606  (stage % 2 == 0 ? vec_ri : vec_ki),
607  solution);
608 *
609  if (stage > 0)
610  sum_previous_bi += bi[stage
611 *
612 - 1];
613  }
614  }
615 *
616  private:
617  std::vector<double> bi;
618  std::vector<double> ai;
619  };
620 *
621 
622  @endcode
623 *
624 * Euler-specific utility functions from @ref step_67 "step-67" :
625 *
626 
627 *
628 * @code
629  enum EulerNumericalFlux
630  {
631  lax_friedrichs_modified,
632  harten_lax_vanleer,
633  };
634  constexpr EulerNumericalFlux numerical_flux_type = lax_friedrichs_modified;
635 *
636 
637 *
638  template <int dim>
639  class ExactSolution : public Function<dim>
640  {
641  public:
642  ExactSolution(const double time)
643  : Function<dim>(dim + 2, time)
644  {}
645 *
646  virtual double value(const Point<dim> & p,
647  const unsigned int component = 0) const override;
648  };
649 *
650 
651 *
652  template <int dim>
653  double ExactSolution<dim>::value(const Point<dim> & x,
654  const unsigned int component) const
655  {
656  const double t = this->get_time();
657 *
658  switch (testcase)
659  {
660  case 0:
661  {
662  Assert(dim == 2, ExcNotImplemented());
663  const double beta = 5;
664 *
665  Point<dim> x0;
666  x0[0] = 5.;
667  const double radius_sqr =
668  (x
669 *
670 - x0).norm_square()
671 *
672 - 2. (x[0]
673 *
674 - x0[0]) t + t t;
675  const double factor =
676  beta / (numbers::PI 2) std::exp(1.
677 *
678 - radius_sqr);
679  const double density_log = std::log2(
680  std::abs(1.
681 *
682 - (gamma
683 *
684 - 1.) / gamma 0.25 factor factor));
685  const double density = std::exp2(density_log (1. / (gamma
686 *
687 - 1.)));
688  const double u = 1.
689 *
690 - factor (x[1]
691 *
692 - x0[1]);
693  const double v = factor (x[0]
694 *
695 - t
696 *
697 - x0[0]);
698 *
699  if (component == 0)
700  return density;
701  else if (component == 1)
702  return density u;
703  else if (component == 2)
704  return density v;
705  else
706  {
707  const double pressure =
708  std::exp2(density_log (gamma / (gamma
709 *
710 - 1.)));
711  return pressure / (gamma
712 *
713 - 1.) +
714  0.5 (density u u + density v v);
715  }
716  }
717 *
718  case 1:
719  {
720  if (component == 0)
721  return 1.;
722  else if (component == 1)
723  return 0.4;
724  else if (component == dim + 1)
725  return 3.097857142857143;
726  else
727  return 0.;
728  }
729 *
730  default:
731  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
732  return 0.;
733  }
734  }
735 *
736 
737 *
738  template <int dim, typename Number>
739  inline DEAL_II_ALWAYS_INLINE
740  Tensor<1, dim, Number>
741  euler_velocity(const Tensor<1, dim + 2, Number> &conserved_variables)
742  {
743  const Number inverse_density = Number(1.) / conserved_variables[0];
744 *
745  Tensor<1, dim, Number> velocity;
746  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
747  velocity[d] = conserved_variables[1 + d] inverse_density;
748 *
749  return velocity;
750  }
751 *
752  template <int dim, typename Number>
753  inline DEAL_II_ALWAYS_INLINE
754  Number
755  euler_pressure(const Tensor<1, dim + 2, Number> &conserved_variables)
756  {
757  const Tensor<1, dim, Number> velocity =
758  euler_velocity<dim>(conserved_variables);
759 *
760  Number rho_u_dot_u = conserved_variables[1] velocity[0];
761  for (unsigned int d = 1; d < dim; ++d)
762  rho_u_dot_u += conserved_variables[1 + d] velocity[d];
763 *
764  return (gamma
765 *
766 - 1.) (conserved_variables[dim + 1]
767 *
768 - 0.5 rho_u_dot_u);
769  }
770 *
771  template <int dim, typename Number>
772  inline DEAL_II_ALWAYS_INLINE
773  Tensor<1, dim + 2, Tensor<1, dim, Number>>
774  euler_flux(const Tensor<1, dim + 2, Number> &conserved_variables)
775  {
776  const Tensor<1, dim, Number> velocity =
777  euler_velocity<dim>(conserved_variables);
778  const Number pressure = euler_pressure<dim>(conserved_variables);
779 *
780  Tensor<1, dim + 2, Tensor<1, dim, Number>> flux;
781  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
782  {
783  flux[0][d] = conserved_variables[1 + d];
784  for (unsigned int e = 0; e < dim; ++e)
785  flux[e + 1][d] = conserved_variables[e + 1] velocity[d];
786  flux[d + 1][d] += pressure;
787  flux[dim + 1][d] =
788  velocity[d] (conserved_variables[dim + 1] + pressure);
789  }
790 *
791  return flux;
792  }
793 *
794  template <int n_components, int dim, typename Number>
795  inline DEAL_II_ALWAYS_INLINE
796  Tensor<1, n_components, Number>
797  operator*(const Tensor<1, n_components, Tensor<1, dim, Number>> &matrix,
798  const Tensor<1, dim, Number> & vector)
799  {
800  Tensor<1, n_components, Number> result;
801  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < n_components; ++d)
802  result[d] = matrix[d] vector;
803  return result;
804  }
805 *
806  template <int dim, typename Number>
807  inline DEAL_II_ALWAYS_INLINE
808  Tensor<1, dim + 2, Number>
809  euler_numerical_flux(const Tensor<1, dim + 2, Number> &u_m,
810  const Tensor<1, dim + 2, Number> &u_p,
811  const Tensor<1, dim, Number> & normal)
812  {
813  const auto velocity_m = euler_velocity<dim>(u_m);
814  const auto velocity_p = euler_velocity<dim>(u_p);
815 *
816  const auto pressure_m = euler_pressure<dim>(u_m);
817  const auto pressure_p = euler_pressure<dim>(u_p);
818 *
819  const auto flux_m = euler_flux<dim>(u_m);
820  const auto flux_p = euler_flux<dim>(u_p);
821 *
822  switch (numerical_flux_type)
823  {
824  case lax_friedrichs_modified:
825  {
826  const auto lambda =
827  0.5 std::sqrt(std::max(velocity_p.norm_square() +
828  gamma pressure_p (1. / u_p[0]),
829  velocity_m.norm_square() +
830  gamma pressure_m (1. / u_m[0])));
831 *
832  return 0.5 (flux_m normal + flux_p normal) +
833  0.5 lambda (u_m
834 *
835 - u_p);
836  }
837 *
838  case harten_lax_vanleer:
839  {
840  const auto avg_velocity_normal =
841  0.5 ((velocity_m + velocity_p) normal);
842  const auto avg_c = std::sqrt(std::abs(
843  0.5 gamma
844  (pressure_p (1. / u_p[0]) + pressure_m (1. / u_m[0]))));
845  const Number s_pos =
846  std::max(Number(), avg_velocity_normal + avg_c);
847  const Number s_neg =
848  std::min(Number(), avg_velocity_normal
849 *
850 - avg_c);
851  const Number inverse_s = Number(1.) / (s_pos
852 *
853 - s_neg);
854 *
855  return inverse_s
856  ((s_pos (flux_m normal)
857 *
858 - s_neg (flux_p normal))
859 *
860 -
861  s_pos s_neg (u_m
862 *
863 - u_p));
864  }
865 *
866  default:
867  {
868  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
869  return {};
870  }
871  }
872  }
873 *
874 
875 *
876  @endcode
877 *
878 * General-purpose utility functions from @ref step_67 "step-67" :
879 *
880 
881 *
882 * @code
883  template <int dim, typename VectorizedArrayType>
884  VectorizedArrayType
885  evaluate_function(const Function<dim> & function,
886  const Point<dim, VectorizedArrayType> &p_vectorized,
887  const unsigned int component)
888  {
889  VectorizedArrayType result;
890  for (unsigned int v = 0; v < VectorizedArrayType::size(); ++v)
891  {
892  Point<dim> p;
893  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
894  p[d] = p_vectorized[d][v];
895  result[v] = function.value(p, component);
896  }
897  return result;
898  }
899 *
900 
901  template <int dim, typename VectorizedArrayType, int n_components = dim + 2>
902  Tensor<1, n_components, VectorizedArrayType>
903  evaluate_function(const Function<dim> & function,
904  const Point<dim, VectorizedArrayType> &p_vectorized)
905  {
906  AssertDimension(function.n_components, n_components);
907  Tensor<1, n_components, VectorizedArrayType> result;
908  for (unsigned int v = 0; v < VectorizedArrayType::size(); ++v)
909  {
910  Point<dim> p;
911  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
912  p[d] = p_vectorized[d][v];
913  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < n_components; ++d)
914  result[d][v] = function.value(p, d);
915  }
916  return result;
917  }
918 *
919 
920  @endcode
921 *
922 * <a name="EuleroperatorusingacellcentricloopandMPI30sharedmemory"></a> <h3>Euler operator using a cell-centric loop and MPI-3.0 shared memory</h3>
923 *
924 
925 *
926 * Euler operator from @ref step_67 "step-67" with some changes as detailed below:
927 *
928 
929 *
930 * @code
931  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
932  class EulerOperator
933  {
934  public:
935  static constexpr unsigned int n_quadrature_points_1d = n_points_1d;
936 *
937  EulerOperator(TimerOutput &timer_output);
938 *
939  ~EulerOperator();
940 *
941  void reinit(const Mapping<dim> & mapping,
942  const DoFHandler<dim> &dof_handler);
943 *
944  void set_inflow_boundary(const types::boundary_id boundary_id,
945  std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> inflow_function);
946 *
947  void set_subsonic_outflow_boundary(
948  const types::boundary_id boundary_id,
949  std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> outflow_energy);
950 *
951  void set_wall_boundary(const types::boundary_id boundary_id);
952 *
953  void set_body_force(std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> body_force);
954 *
955  void
956  perform_stage(const unsigned int stage,
957  const Number cur_time,
958  const Number bi,
959  const Number ai,
960  const LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &current_ri,
961  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> & vec_ki,
962  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const;
963 *
964  void project(const Function<dim> & function,
965  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const;
966 *
967  std::array<double, 3> compute_errors(
968  const Function<dim> & function,
969  const LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const;
970 *
971  double compute_cell_transport_speed(
972  const LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const;
973 *
974  void
975  initialize_vector(LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &vector) const;
976 *
977  private:
978  @endcode
979 *
980 * Instance of SubCommunicatorWrapper containing the sub-communicator, which we need to pass to MatrixFree::reinit() to be able to exploit MPI-3.0 shared-memory capabilities:
981 *
982 
983 *
984 * @code
985  MPI_Comm subcommunicator;
986 *
987  MatrixFree<dim, Number, VectorizedArrayType> data;
988 *
989  TimerOutput &timer;
990 *
991  std::map<types::boundary_id, std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>>>
992  inflow_boundaries;
993  std::map<types::boundary_id, std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>>>
994  subsonic_outflow_boundaries;
995  std::set<types::boundary_id> wall_boundaries;
996  std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> body_force;
997  };
998 *
999 
1000 *
1001  @endcode
1002 *
1003 * New constructor, which creates a sub-communicator. The user can specify the size of the sub-communicator via the global parameter group_size. If the size is set to
1004 *
1005 * - , all MPI processes of a shared-memory domain are combined to a group. The specified size is decisive for the benefit of the shared-memory capabilities of MatrixFree and, therefore, setting the <code>size</code> to <code>-1</code> is a reasonable choice. By setting, the size to <code>1</code> users explicitly disable the MPI-3.0 shared-memory features of MatrixFree and rely completely on MPI-2.0 features, like <code>MPI_Isend</code> and <code>MPI_Irecv</code> .
1006 *
1007 
1008 *
1009 * @code
1010  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1011  EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::EulerOperator(TimerOutput &timer)
1012  : timer(timer)
1013  {
1014  #if DEAL_II_MPI_VERSION_GTE(3, 0)
1015  if (group_size == 1)
1016  {
1017  this->subcommunicator = MPI_COMM_SELF;
1018  }
1019  else if (group_size == numbers::invalid_unsigned_int)
1020  {
1021  const auto rank = Utilities::MPI::this_mpi_process(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1022 *
1023  MPI_Comm_split_type(MPI_COMM_WORLD,
1024  MPI_COMM_TYPE_SHARED,
1025  rank,
1026  MPI_INFO_NULL,
1027  &subcommunicator);
1028  }
1029  else
1030  {
1031  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
1032  }
1033  #else
1034  (void)subcommunicator;
1035  (void)group_size;
1036  this->subcommunicator = MPI_COMM_SELF;
1037  #endif
1038  }
1039 *
1040 
1041  @endcode
1042 *
1043 * New destructor responsible for freeing of the sub-communicator.
1044 *
1045 
1046 *
1047 * @code
1048  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1049  EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::~EulerOperator()
1050  {
1051  #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
1052  if (this->subcommunicator != MPI_COMM_SELF)
1053  MPI_Comm_free(&subcommunicator);
1054  #endif
1055  }
1056 *
1057 
1058  @endcode
1059 *
1060 * Modified reinit() function to setup the internal data structures in MatrixFree in a way that it is usable by the cell-centric loops and the MPI-3.0 shared-memory capabilities are used:
1061 *
1062 
1063 *
1064 * @code
1065  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1066  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::reinit(
1067  const Mapping<dim> & mapping,
1068  const DoFHandler<dim> &dof_handler)
1069  {
1070  const std::vector<const DoFHandler<dim>> dof_handlers = {&dof_handler};
1071  const AffineConstraints<double> dummy;
1072  const std::vector<const AffineConstraints<double>> constraints = {&dummy};
1073  const std::vector<Quadrature<1>> quadratures = {QGauss<1>(n_q_points_1d),
1074  QGauss<1>(fe_degree + 1)};
1075 *
1076  typename MatrixFree<dim, Number, VectorizedArrayType>::AdditionalData
1077  additional_data;
1078  additional_data.mapping_update_flags =
1079  (update_gradients | update_JxW_values | update_quadrature_points |
1080  update_values);
1081  additional_data.mapping_update_flags_inner_faces =
1082  (update_JxW_values | update_quadrature_points | update_normal_vectors |
1083  update_values);
1084  additional_data.mapping_update_flags_boundary_faces =
1085  (update_JxW_values | update_quadrature_points | update_normal_vectors |
1086  update_values);
1087  additional_data.tasks_parallel_scheme =
1088  MatrixFree<dim, Number, VectorizedArrayType>::AdditionalData::none;
1089 *
1090  @endcode
1091 *
1092 * Categorize cells so that all lanes have the same boundary IDs for each face. This is strictly not necessary, however, allows to write simpler code in EulerOperator::perform_stage() without masking, since it is guaranteed that all cells grouped together (in a VectorizedArray) have to perform exactly the same operation also on the faces.
1093 *
1094 
1095 *
1096 * @code
1097  MatrixFreeTools::categorize_by_boundary_ids(dof_handler.get_triangulation(),
1098  additional_data);
1099 *
1100  @endcode
1101 *
1102 * Enable MPI-3.0 shared-memory capabilities within MatrixFree by providing the sub-communicator:
1103 *
1104 
1105 *
1106 * @code
1107  additional_data.communicator_sm = subcommunicator;
1108 *
1109  data.reinit(
1110  mapping, dof_handlers, constraints, quadratures, additional_data);
1111  }
1112 *
1113 
1114  @endcode
1115 *
1116 * The following function does an entire stage of a Runge--Kutta update and is
1117 *
1118 
1119 *
1120 *
1121 * - alongside the slightly modified setup
1122 *
1123 * - the heart of this tutorial compared to @ref step_67 "step-67" .
1124 * In contrast to @ref step_67 "step-67" , we are not executing the advection step (using MatrixFree::loop()) and the inverse mass-matrix step (using MatrixFree::cell_loop()) in sequence, but evaluate everything in one go inside of MatrixFree::loop_cell_centric(). This function expects a single function that is executed on each locally-owned (macro) cell as parameter so that we need to loop over all faces of that cell and perform needed integration steps on our own.
1125 * The following function contains to a large extent copies of the following functions from @ref step_67 "step-67" so that comments related the evaluation of the weak form are skipped here:
1126 *
1127 
1128 *
1129 *
1130 * - <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_cell</code>
1131 *
1132 
1133 *
1134 *
1135 * - <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_face</code>
1136 *
1137 
1138 *
1139 *
1140 * - <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_boundary_face</code>
1141 *
1142 
1143 *
1144 *
1145 * - <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_inverse_mass_matrix</code>
1146 *
1147 
1148 *
1149 * @code
1150  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1151  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::perform_stage(
1152  const unsigned int stage,
1153  const Number current_time,
1154  const Number bi,
1155  const Number ai,
1156  const LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &current_ri,
1157  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> & vec_ki,
1158  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> & solution) const
1159  {
1160  for (auto &i : inflow_boundaries)
1161  i.second->set_time(current_time);
1162  for (auto &i : subsonic_outflow_boundaries)
1163  i.second->set_time(current_time);
1164 *
1165  @endcode
1166 *
1167 * Run a cell-centric loop by calling MatrixFree::loop_cell_centric() and providing a lambda containing the effects of the cell, face and boundary-face integrals:
1168 *
1169 
1170 *
1171 * @code
1172  data.template loop_cell_centric<LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number>,
1173  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number>>(
1174  [&](const auto &data, auto &dst, const auto &src, const auto cell_range) {
1175  using FECellIntegral = FEEvaluation<dim,
1176  degree,
1177  n_points_1d,
1178  dim + 2,
1179  Number,
1180  VectorizedArrayType>;
1181  using FEFaceIntegral = FEFaceEvaluation<dim,
1182  degree,
1183  n_points_1d,
1184  dim + 2,
1185  Number,
1186  VectorizedArrayType>;
1187 *
1188  FECellIntegral phi(data);
1189  FECellIntegral phi_temp(data);
1190  FEFaceIntegral phi_m(data, true);
1191  FEFaceIntegral phi_p(data, false);
1192 *
1193  Tensor<1, dim, VectorizedArrayType> constant_body_force;
1194  const Functions::ConstantFunction<dim>constant_function =
1195  dynamic_cast<Functions::ConstantFunction<dim>>(body_force.get());
1196 *
1197  if (constant_function)
1198  constant_body_force =
1199  evaluate_function<dim, VectorizedArrayType, dim>(
1200  constant_function, Point<dim, VectorizedArrayType>());
1201 *
1202  const ::internal::EvaluatorTensorProduct<
1203  ::internal::EvaluatorVariant::evaluate_evenodd,
1204  dim,
1205  n_points_1d,
1206  n_points_1d,
1207  VectorizedArrayType>
1208  eval(AlignedVector<VectorizedArrayType>(),
1209  data.get_shape_info().data[0].shape_gradients_collocation_eo,
1210  AlignedVector<VectorizedArrayType>());
1211 *
1212  AlignedVector<VectorizedArrayType> buffer(phi.static_n_q_points
1213  phi.n_components);
1214 *
1215  @endcode
1216 *
1217 * Loop over all cell batches:
1218 *
1219 
1220 *
1221 * @code
1222  for (unsigned int cell = cell_range.first; cell < cell_range.second;
1223  ++cell)
1224  {
1225  phi.reinit(cell);
1226 *
1227  if (ai != Number())
1228  phi_temp.reinit(cell);
1229 *
1230  @endcode
1231 *
1232 * Read values from global vector and compute the values at the quadrature points:
1233 *
1234 
1235 *
1236 * @code
1237  if (ai != Number() && stage == 0)
1238  {
1239  phi.read_dof_values(src);
1240 *
1241  for (unsigned int i = 0;
1242  i < phi.static_dofs_per_component (dim + 2);
1243  ++i)
1244  phi_temp.begin_dof_values()[i] = phi.begin_dof_values()[i];
1245 *
1246  phi.evaluate(EvaluationFlags::values);
1247  }
1248  else
1249  {
1250  phi.gather_evaluate(src, EvaluationFlags::values);
1251  }
1252 *
1253  @endcode
1254 *
1255 * Buffer the computed values at the quadrature points, since these are overridden by FEEvaluation::submit_value() in the next step, however, are needed later on for the face integrals:
1256 *
1257 
1258 *
1259 * @code
1260  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < phi.static_n_q_points (dim + 2); ++i)
1261  buffer[i] = phi.begin_values()[i];
1262 *
1263  @endcode
1264 *
1265 * Apply the cell integral at the cell quadrature points. See also the function <code>EulerOperator::local_apply_cell()</code> from @ref step_67 "step-67" :
1266 *
1267 
1268 *
1269 * @code
1270  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.n_q_points; ++q)
1271  {
1272  const auto w_q = phi.get_value(q);
1273  phi.submit_gradient(euler_flux<dim>(w_q), q);
1274  if (body_force.get() != nullptr)
1275  {
1276  const Tensor<1, dim, VectorizedArrayType> force =
1277  constant_function ?
1278  constant_body_force :
1279  evaluate_function<dim, VectorizedArrayType, dim>(
1280  body_force, phi.quadrature_point(q));
1281 *
1282  Tensor<1, dim + 2, VectorizedArrayType> forcing;
1283  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1284  forcing[d + 1] = w_q[0] force[d];
1285  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1286  forcing[dim + 1] += force[d] w_q[d + 1];
1287 *
1288  phi.submit_value(forcing, q);
1289  }
1290  }
1291 *
1292  @endcode
1293 *
1294 * Test with the gradient of the test functions in the quadrature points. We skip the interpolation back to the support points of the element, since we first collect all contributions in the cell quadrature points and only perform the interpolation back as the final step.
1295 *
1296 
1297 *
1298 * @code
1299  {
1300  autovalues_ptr = phi.begin_values();
1301  autogradient_ptr = phi.begin_gradients();
1302 *
1303  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < dim + 2; ++c)
1304  {
1305  if (dim >= 1 && body_force.get() == nullptr)
1306  eval.template gradients<0, false, false>(
1307  gradient_ptr + phi.static_n_q_points 0, values_ptr);
1308  else if (dim >= 1)
1309  eval.template gradients<0, false, true>(
1310  gradient_ptr + phi.static_n_q_points 0, values_ptr);
1311  if (dim >= 2)
1312  eval.template gradients<1, false, true>(
1313  gradient_ptr + phi.static_n_q_points 1, values_ptr);
1314  if (dim >= 3)
1315  eval.template gradients<2, false, true>(
1316  gradient_ptr + phi.static_n_q_points 2, values_ptr);
1317 *
1318  values_ptr += phi.static_n_q_points;
1319  gradient_ptr += phi.static_n_q_points dim;
1320  }
1321  }
1322 *
1323  @endcode
1324 *
1325 * Loop over all faces of the current cell:
1326 *
1327 
1328 *
1329 * @code
1330  for (unsigned int face = 0;
1331  face < GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell;
1332  ++face)
1333  {
1334  @endcode
1335 *
1336 * Determine the boundary ID of the current face. Since we have set up MatrixFree in a way that all filled lanes have guaranteed the same boundary ID, we can select the boundary ID of the first lane.
1337 *
1338 
1339 *
1340 * @code
1341  const auto boundary_ids =
1342  data.get_faces_by_cells_boundary_id(cell, face);
1343 *
1344  Assert(std::equal(boundary_ids.begin(),
1345  boundary_ids.begin() +
1346  data.n_active_entries_per_cell_batch(cell),
1347  boundary_ids.begin()),
1348  ExcMessage("Boundary IDs of lanes differ."));
1349 *
1350  const auto boundary_id = boundary_ids[0];
1351 *
1352  phi_m.reinit(cell, face);
1353 *
1354  @endcode
1355 *
1356 * Interpolate the values from the cell quadrature points to the quadrature points of the current face via a simple 1D interpolation:
1357 *
1358 
1359 *
1360 * @code
1361  internal::FEFaceNormalEvaluationImpl<dim,
1362  n_points_1d
1363 *
1364 - 1,
1365  VectorizedArrayType>::
1366  template interpolate_quadrature<true, false>(
1367  dim + 2,
1368  data.get_shape_info(),
1369  buffer.data(),
1370  phi_m.begin_values(),
1371  false,
1372  face);
1373 *
1374  @endcode
1375 *
1376 * Check if the face is an internal or a boundary face and select a different code path based on this information:
1377 *
1378 
1379 *
1380 * @code
1381  if (boundary_id == numbers::internal_face_boundary_id)
1382  {
1383  @endcode
1384 *
1385 * Process and internal face. The following lines of code are a copy of the function <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_face</code> from @ref step_67 "step-67" :
1386 *
1387 
1388 *
1389 * @code
1390  phi_p.reinit(cell, face);
1391  phi_p.gather_evaluate(src, EvaluationFlags::values);
1392 *
1393  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi_m.n_q_points; ++q)
1394  {
1395  const auto numerical_flux =
1396  euler_numerical_flux<dim>(phi_m.get_value(q),
1397  phi_p.get_value(q),
1398  phi_m.get_normal_vector(q));
1399  phi_m.submit_value(-numerical_flux, q);
1400  }
1401  }
1402  else
1403  {
1404  @endcode
1405 *
1406 * Process a boundary face. These following lines of code are a copy of the function <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_boundary_face</code> from @ref step_67 "step-67" :
1407 *
1408 
1409 *
1410 * @code
1411  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi_m.n_q_points; ++q)
1412  {
1413  const auto w_m = phi_m.get_value(q);
1414  const auto normal = phi_m.get_normal_vector(q);
1415 *
1416  auto rho_u_dot_n = w_m[1] normal[0];
1417  for (unsigned int d = 1; d < dim; ++d)
1418  rho_u_dot_n += w_m[1 + d] normal[d];
1419 *
1420  bool at_outflow = false;
1421 *
1422  Tensor<1, dim + 2, VectorizedArrayType> w_p;
1423 *
1424  if (wall_boundaries.find(boundary_id) !=
1425  wall_boundaries.end())
1426  {
1427  w_p[0] = w_m[0];
1428  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1429  w_p[d + 1] =
1430  w_m[d + 1]
1431 *
1432 - 2. rho_u_dot_n normal[d];
1433  w_p[dim + 1] = w_m[dim + 1];
1434  }
1435  else if (inflow_boundaries.find(boundary_id) !=
1436  inflow_boundaries.end())
1437  w_p = evaluate_function(
1438  inflow_boundaries.find(boundary_id)->second,
1439  phi_m.quadrature_point(q));
1440  else if (subsonic_outflow_boundaries.find(
1441  boundary_id) !=
1442  subsonic_outflow_boundaries.end())
1443  {
1444  w_p = w_m;
1445  w_p[dim + 1] =
1446  evaluate_function(*subsonic_outflow_boundaries
1447  .find(boundary_id)
1448 *
1449 
1450 
1451 *
1452 *
1453 
1454 
1455 *
1456 *
1457 
1458 
1459 *
1460 *
1461 
1462 
1463 *
1464 *
1465 
1466 
1467 *
1468 *
1469 
1470 
1471 *
1472 *
1473 
1474 
1475 *
1476 *
1477 
1478 
1479 *
1480 *
1481 
1482 
1483 *
1484 *
1485 
1486 
1487 *
1488 *
1489 
1490 
1491 *
1492 *
1493 
1494 
1495 *
1496 *
1497 
1498 
1499 *
1500 *
1501 
1502 
1503 *
1504 *
1505 
1506 
1507 *
1508 *
1509 
1510 
1511 *
1512 *
1513 
1514 
1515 *
1516 *
1517 
1518 
1519 *
1520 *
1521 
1522 
1523 *
1524 *
1525 
1526 
1527 *
1528 *
1529 
1530 
1531 *
1532 *
1533 
1534 
1535 *
1536 *
1537 
1538 
1539 *
1540 *
1541 
1542 
1543 *
1544 *
1545 
1546 
1547 *
1548 *
1549 
1550 
1551 *
1552 *
1553 
1554 
1555 *
1556 *
1557 
1558 
1559 *
1560 *
1561 
1562 
1563 *
1564 *
1565 
1566 
1567 *
1568 *
1569 
1570 
1571 *
1572 *
1573 
1574 
1575 *
1576 *
1577 
1578 
1579 *
1580 *
1581 
1582 
1583 *
1584 *
1585 
1586 
1587 *
1588 *
1589 
1590 
1591 *
1592 *
1593 
1594 
1595 *
1596 *
1597 
1598 
1599 *
1600 *
1601 
1602 
1603 *
1604 *
1605 
1606 
1607 *
1608 *
1609 
1610 
1611 *
1612 *
1613 
1614 
1615 *
1616 *
1617 
1618 
1619 *
1620 *
1621 
1622 
1623 *
1624 *
1625 
1626 
1627 *
1628 *
1629 
1630 
1631 *
1632 *
1633 
1634 
1635 *
1636 *
1637 
1638 
1639 *
1640 *
1641 
1642 
1643 *
1644 *
1645 
1646 
1647 *
1648 *
1649 
1650 
1651 *
1652 *
1653 
1654 
1655 *
1656 *
1657 ->second,
1658  phi_m.quadrature_point(q),
1659  dim + 1);
1660  at_outflow = true;
1661  }
1662  else
1663  AssertThrow(false,
1664  ExcMessage(
1665  "Unknown boundary id, did "
1666  "you set a boundary condition for "
1667  "this part of the domain boundary?"));
1668 *
1669  auto flux = euler_numerical_flux<dim>(w_m, w_p, normal);
1670 *
1671  if (at_outflow)
1672  for (unsigned int v = 0;
1673  v < VectorizedArrayType::size();
1674  ++v)
1675  {
1676  if (rho_u_dot_n[v] <
1677 *
1678 -1e-12)
1679  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1680  flux[d + 1][v] = 0.;
1681  }
1682 *
1683  phi_m.submit_value(-flux, q);
1684  }
1685  }
1686 *
1687  @endcode
1688 *
1689 * Evaluate local integrals related to cell by quadrature and add into cell contribution via a simple 1D interpolation:
1690 *
1691 
1692 *
1693 * @code
1694  internal::FEFaceNormalEvaluationImpl<dim,
1695  n_points_1d
1696 *
1697 - 1,
1698  VectorizedArrayType>::
1699  template interpolate_quadrature<false, true>(
1700  dim + 2,
1701  data.get_shape_info(),
1702  phi_m.begin_values(),
1703  phi.begin_values(),
1704  false,
1705  face);
1706  }
1707 *
1708  @endcode
1709 *
1710 * Apply inverse mass matrix in the cell quadrature points. See also the function <code>EulerDG::EulerOperator::local_apply_inverse_mass_matrix()</code> from @ref step_67 "step-67" :
1711 *
1712 
1713 *
1714 * @code
1715  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.static_n_q_points; ++q)
1716  {
1717  const auto factor = VectorizedArrayType(1.0) / phi.JxW(q);
1718  for (unsigned int c = 0; c < dim + 2; ++c)
1719  phi.begin_values()[c phi.static_n_q_points + q] =
1720  phi.begin_values()[c phi.static_n_q_points + q] factor;
1721  }
1722 *
1723  @endcode
1724 *
1725 * Transform values from collocation space to the original Gauss-Lobatto space:
1726 *
1727 
1728 *
1729 * @code
1730  internal::FEEvaluationImplBasisChange<
1731  ::internal::EvaluatorVariant::evaluate_evenodd,
1732  internal::EvaluatorQuantity::hessian,
1733  dim,
1734  degree + 1,
1735  n_points_1d,
1736  VectorizedArrayType,
1737  VectorizedArrayType>::do_backward(dim + 2,
1738  data.get_shape_info()
1739  .data[0]
1740  .inverse_shape_values_eo,
1741  false,
1742  phi.begin_values(),
1743  phi.begin_dof_values());
1744 *
1745  @endcode
1746 *
1747 * Perform Runge-Kutta update and write results back to global vectors:
1748 *
1749 
1750 *
1751 * @code
1752  if (ai == Number())
1753  {
1754  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.static_dofs_per_cell; ++q)
1755  phi.begin_dof_values()[q] = bi phi.begin_dof_values()[q];
1756  phi.distribute_local_to_global(solution);
1757  }
1758  else
1759  {
1760  if (stage != 0)
1761  phi_temp.read_dof_values(solution);
1762 *
1763  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.static_dofs_per_cell; ++q)
1764  {
1765  const auto K_i = phi.begin_dof_values()[q];
1766 *
1767  phi.begin_dof_values()[q] =
1768  phi_temp.begin_dof_values()[q] + (ai K_i);
1769 *
1770  phi_temp.begin_dof_values()[q] += bi K_i;
1771  }
1772  phi.set_dof_values(dst);
1773  phi_temp.set_dof_values(solution);
1774  }
1775  }
1776  },
1777  vec_ki,
1778  current_ri,
1779  true,
1780  MatrixFree<dim, Number, VectorizedArrayType>::DataAccessOnFaces::values);
1781  }
1782 *
1783 
1784 *
1785  @endcode
1786 *
1787 * From here, the code of @ref step_67 "step-67" has not changed.
1788 *
1789 
1790 *
1791 * @code
1792  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1793  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::initialize_vector(
1794  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &vector) const
1795  {
1796  data.initialize_dof_vector(vector);
1797  }
1798 *
1799 
1800 *
1801  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1802  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::set_inflow_boundary(
1803  const types::boundary_id boundary_id,
1804  std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> inflow_function)
1805  {
1806  AssertThrow(subsonic_outflow_boundaries.find(boundary_id) ==
1807  subsonic_outflow_boundaries.end() &&
1808  wall_boundaries.find(boundary_id) == wall_boundaries.end(),
1809  ExcMessage("You already set the boundary with id " +
1810  std::to_string(static_cast<int>(boundary_id)) +
1811  " to another type of boundary before now setting " +
1812  "it as inflow"));
1813  AssertThrow(inflow_function->n_components == dim + 2,
1814  ExcMessage("Expected function with dim+2 components"));
1815 *
1816  inflow_boundaries[boundary_id] = std::move(inflow_function);
1817  }
1818 *
1819 
1820 *
1821  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1822  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::set_subsonic_outflow_boundary(
1823  const types::boundary_id boundary_id,
1824  std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> outflow_function)
1825  {
1826  AssertThrow(inflow_boundaries.find(boundary_id) ==
1827  inflow_boundaries.end() &&
1828  wall_boundaries.find(boundary_id) == wall_boundaries.end(),
1829  ExcMessage("You already set the boundary with id " +
1830  std::to_string(static_cast<int>(boundary_id)) +
1831  " to another type of boundary before now setting " +
1832  "it as subsonic outflow"));
1833  AssertThrow(outflow_function->n_components == dim + 2,
1834  ExcMessage("Expected function with dim+2 components"));
1835 *
1836  subsonic_outflow_boundaries[boundary_id] = std::move(outflow_function);
1837  }
1838 *
1839 
1840 *
1841  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1842  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::set_wall_boundary(
1843  const types::boundary_id boundary_id)
1844  {
1845  AssertThrow(inflow_boundaries.find(boundary_id) ==
1846  inflow_boundaries.end() &&
1847  subsonic_outflow_boundaries.find(boundary_id) ==
1848  subsonic_outflow_boundaries.end(),
1849  ExcMessage("You already set the boundary with id " +
1850  std::to_string(static_cast<int>(boundary_id)) +
1851  " to another type of boundary before now setting " +
1852  "it as wall boundary"));
1853 *
1854  wall_boundaries.insert(boundary_id);
1855  }
1856 *
1857 
1858 *
1859  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1860  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::set_body_force(
1861  std::unique_ptr<Function<dim>> body_force)
1862  {
1863  AssertDimension(body_force->n_components, dim);
1864 *
1865  this->body_force = std::move(body_force);
1866  }
1867 *
1868 
1869 *
1870  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1871  void EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::project(
1872  const Function<dim> & function,
1873  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const
1874  {
1875  FEEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, dim + 2, Number, VectorizedArrayType>
1876  phi(data, 0, 1);
1877  MatrixFreeOperators::CellwiseInverseMassMatrix<dim,
1878  degree,
1879  dim + 2,
1880  Number,
1881  VectorizedArrayType>
1882  inverse(phi);
1883  solution.zero_out_ghost_values();
1884  for (unsigned int cell = 0; cell < data.n_cell_batches(); ++cell)
1885  {
1886  phi.reinit(cell);
1887  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.n_q_points; ++q)
1888  phi.submit_dof_value(evaluate_function(function,
1889  phi.quadrature_point(q)),
1890  q);
1891  inverse.transform_from_q_points_to_basis(dim + 2,
1892  phi.begin_dof_values(),
1893  phi.begin_dof_values());
1894  phi.set_dof_values(solution);
1895  }
1896  }
1897 *
1898 
1899 *
1900  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1901  std::array<double, 3> EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::compute_errors(
1902  const Function<dim> & function,
1903  const LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const
1904  {
1905  TimerOutput::Scope t(timer, "compute errors");
1906  double errors_squared[3] = {};
1907  FEEvaluation<dim, degree, n_points_1d, dim + 2, Number, VectorizedArrayType>
1908  phi(data, 0, 0);
1909 *
1910  for (unsigned int cell = 0; cell < data.n_cell_batches(); ++cell)
1911  {
1912  phi.reinit(cell);
1913  phi.gather_evaluate(solution, EvaluationFlags::values);
1914  VectorizedArrayType local_errors_squared[3] = {};
1915  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.n_q_points; ++q)
1916  {
1917  const auto error =
1918  evaluate_function(function, phi.quadrature_point(q))
1919 *
1920 -
1921  phi.get_value(q);
1922  const auto JxW = phi.JxW(q);
1923 *
1924  local_errors_squared[0] += error[0] error[0] JxW;
1925  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1926  local_errors_squared[1] += (error[d + 1] error[d + 1]) JxW;
1927  local_errors_squared[2] += (error[dim + 1] error[dim + 1]) JxW;
1928  }
1929  for (unsigned int v = 0; v < data.n_active_entries_per_cell_batch(cell);
1930  ++v)
1931  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < 3; ++d)
1932  errors_squared[d] += local_errors_squared[d][v];
1933  }
1934 *
1935  Utilities::MPI::sum(errors_squared, MPI_COMM_WORLD, errors_squared);
1936 *
1937  std::array<double, 3> errors;
1938  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < 3; ++d)
1939  errors[d] = std::sqrt(errors_squared[d]);
1940 *
1941  return errors;
1942  }
1943 *
1944 
1945 *
1946  template <int dim, int degree, int n_points_1d>
1947  double EulerOperator<dim, degree, n_points_1d>::compute_cell_transport_speed(
1948  const LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> &solution) const
1949  {
1950  TimerOutput::Scope t(timer, "compute transport speed");
1951  Number max_transport = 0;
1952  FEEvaluation<dim, degree, degree + 1, dim + 2, Number, VectorizedArrayType>
1953  phi(data, 0, 1);
1954 *
1955  for (unsigned int cell = 0; cell < data.n_cell_batches(); ++cell)
1956  {
1957  phi.reinit(cell);
1958  phi.gather_evaluate(solution, EvaluationFlags::values);
1959  VectorizedArrayType local_max = 0.;
1960  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < phi.n_q_points; ++q)
1961  {
1962  const auto solution = phi.get_value(q);
1963  const auto velocity = euler_velocity<dim>(solution);
1964  const auto pressure = euler_pressure<dim>(solution);
1965 *
1966  const auto inverse_jacobian = phi.inverse_jacobian(q);
1967  const auto convective_speed = inverse_jacobian velocity;
1968  VectorizedArrayType convective_limit = 0.;
1969  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1970  convective_limit =
1971  std::max(convective_limit, std::abs(convective_speed[d]));
1972 *
1973  const auto speed_of_sound =
1974  std::sqrt(gamma pressure (1. / solution[0]));
1975 *
1976  Tensor<1, dim, VectorizedArrayType> eigenvector;
1977  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1978  eigenvector[d] = 1.;
1979  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < 5; ++i)
1980  {
1981  eigenvector = transpose(inverse_jacobian)
1982  (inverse_jacobian eigenvector);
1983  VectorizedArrayType eigenvector_norm = 0.;
1984  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
1985  eigenvector_norm =
1986  std::max(eigenvector_norm, std::abs(eigenvector[d]));
1987  eigenvector /= eigenvector_norm;
1988  }
1989  const auto jac_times_ev = inverse_jacobian eigenvector;
1990  const auto max_eigenvalue = std::sqrt(
1991  (jac_times_ev jac_times_ev) / (eigenvector eigenvector));
1992  local_max =
1993  std::max(local_max,
1994  max_eigenvalue speed_of_sound + convective_limit);
1995  }
1996 *
1997  for (unsigned int v = 0; v < data.n_active_entries_per_cell_batch(cell);
1998  ++v)
1999  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < 3; ++d)
2000  max_transport = std::max(max_transport, local_max[v]);
2001  }
2002 *
2003  max_transport = Utilities::MPI::max(max_transport, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2004 *
2005  return max_transport;
2006  }
2007 *
2008 
2009 *
2010  template <int dim>
2011  class EulerProblem
2012  {
2013  public:
2014  EulerProblem();
2015 *
2016  void run();
2017 *
2018  private:
2019  void make_grid_and_dofs();
2020 *
2021  void output_results(const unsigned int result_number);
2022 *
2023  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> solution;
2024 *
2025  ConditionalOStream pcout;
2026 *
2027  #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_P4EST
2028  parallel::distributed::Triangulation<dim> triangulation;
2029  #else
2030  Triangulation<dim> triangulation;
2031  #endif
2032 *
2033  FESystem<dim> fe;
2034  MappingQGeneric<dim> mapping;
2035  DoFHandler<dim> dof_handler;
2036 *
2037  TimerOutput timer;
2038 *
2039  EulerOperator<dim, fe_degree, n_q_points_1d> euler_operator;
2040 *
2041  double time, time_step;
2042 *
2043  class Postprocessor : public DataPostprocessor<dim>
2044  {
2045  public:
2046  Postprocessor();
2047 *
2048  virtual void evaluate_vector_field(
2049  const DataPostprocessorInputs::Vector<dim> &inputs,
2050  std::vector<Vector<double>> &computed_quantities) const override;
2051 *
2052  virtual std::vector<std::string> get_names() const override;
2053 *
2054  virtual std::vector<
2055  DataComponentInterpretation::DataComponentInterpretation>
2056  get_data_component_interpretation() const override;
2057 *
2058  virtual UpdateFlags get_needed_update_flags() const override;
2059 *
2060  private:
2061  const bool do_schlieren_plot;
2062  };
2063  };
2064 *
2065 
2066 *
2067  template <int dim>
2068  EulerProblem<dim>::Postprocessor::Postprocessor()
2069  : do_schlieren_plot(dim == 2)
2070  {}
2071 *
2072 
2073 *
2074  template <int dim>
2075  void EulerProblem<dim>::Postprocessor::evaluate_vector_field(
2076  const DataPostprocessorInputs::Vector<dim> &inputs,
2077  std::vector<Vector<double>> & computed_quantities) const
2078  {
2079  const unsigned int n_evaluation_points = inputs.solution_values.size();
2080 *
2081  if (do_schlieren_plot == true)
2082  Assert(inputs.solution_gradients.size() == n_evaluation_points,
2083  ExcInternalError());
2084 *
2085  Assert(computed_quantities.size() == n_evaluation_points,
2086  ExcInternalError());
2087  Assert(inputs.solution_values[0].size() == dim + 2, ExcInternalError());
2088  Assert(computed_quantities[0].size() ==
2089  dim + 2 + (do_schlieren_plot == true ? 1 : 0),
2090  ExcInternalError());
2091 *
2092  for (unsigned int q = 0; q < n_evaluation_points; ++q)
2093  {
2094  Tensor<1, dim + 2> solution;
2095  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim + 2; ++d)
2096  solution[d] = inputs.solution_values[q](d);
2097 *
2098  const double density = solution[0];
2099  const Tensor<1, dim> velocity = euler_velocity<dim>(solution);
2100  const double pressure = euler_pressure<dim>(solution);
2101 *
2102  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2103  computed_quantities[q](d) = velocity[d];
2104  computed_quantities[q](dim) = pressure;
2105  computed_quantities[q](dim + 1) = std::sqrt(gamma pressure / density);
2106 *
2107  if (do_schlieren_plot == true)
2108  computed_quantities[q](dim + 2) =
2109  inputs.solution_gradients[q][0] inputs.solution_gradients[q][0];
2110  }
2111  }
2112 *
2113 
2114 *
2115  template <int dim>
2116  std::vector<std::string> EulerProblem<dim>::Postprocessor::get_names() const
2117  {
2118  std::vector<std::string> names;
2119  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2120  names.emplace_back("velocity");
2121  names.emplace_back("pressure");
2122  names.emplace_back("speed_of_sound");
2123 *
2124  if (do_schlieren_plot == true)
2125  names.emplace_back("schlieren_plot");
2126 *
2127  return names;
2128  }
2129 *
2130 
2131 *
2132  template <int dim>
2133  std::vector<DataComponentInterpretation::DataComponentInterpretation>
2134  EulerProblem<dim>::Postprocessor::get_data_component_interpretation() const
2135  {
2136  std::vector<DataComponentInterpretation::DataComponentInterpretation>
2137  interpretation;
2138  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2139  interpretation.push_back(
2140  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_part_of_vector);
2141  interpretation.push_back(DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2142  interpretation.push_back(DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2143 *
2144  if (do_schlieren_plot == true)
2145  interpretation.push_back(
2146  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2147 *
2148  return interpretation;
2149  }
2150 *
2151 
2152 *
2153  template <int dim>
2154  UpdateFlags EulerProblem<dim>::Postprocessor::get_needed_update_flags() const
2155  {
2156  if (do_schlieren_plot == true)
2157  return update_values | update_gradients;
2158  else
2159  return update_values;
2160  }
2161 *
2162 
2163 *
2164  template <int dim>
2165  EulerProblem<dim>::EulerProblem()
2166  : pcout(std::cout, Utilities::MPI::this_mpi_process(MPI_COMM_WORLD) == 0)
2167  #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_P4EST
2168  , triangulation(MPI_COMM_WORLD)
2169  #endif
2170  , fe(FE_DGQ<dim>(fe_degree), dim + 2)
2171  , mapping(fe_degree)
2172  , dof_handler(triangulation)
2173  , timer(pcout, TimerOutput::never, TimerOutput::wall_times)
2174  , euler_operator(timer)
2175  , time(0)
2176  , time_step(0)
2177  {}
2178 *
2179 
2180 *
2181  template <int dim>
2182  void EulerProblem<dim>::make_grid_and_dofs()
2183  {
2184  switch (testcase)
2185  {
2186  case 0:
2187  {
2188  Point<dim> lower_left;
2189  for (unsigned int d = 1; d < dim; ++d)
2190  lower_left[d] =
2191 *
2192 -5;
2193 *
2194  Point<dim> upper_right;
2195  upper_right[0] = 10;
2196  for (unsigned int d = 1; d < dim; ++d)
2197  upper_right[d] = 5;
2198 *
2199  GridGenerator::hyper_rectangle(triangulation,
2200  lower_left,
2201  upper_right);
2202  triangulation.refine_global(2);
2203 *
2204  euler_operator.set_inflow_boundary(
2205  0, std::make_unique<ExactSolution<dim>>(0));
2206 *
2207  break;
2208  }
2209 *
2210  case 1:
2211  {
2212  GridGenerator::channel_with_cylinder(
2213  triangulation, 0.03, 1, 0, true);
2214 *
2215  euler_operator.set_inflow_boundary(
2216  0, std::make_unique<ExactSolution<dim>>(0));
2217  euler_operator.set_subsonic_outflow_boundary(
2218  1, std::make_unique<ExactSolution<dim>>(0));
2219 *
2220  euler_operator.set_wall_boundary(2);
2221  euler_operator.set_wall_boundary(3);
2222 *
2223  if (dim == 3)
2224  euler_operator.set_body_force(
2225  std::make_unique<Functions::ConstantFunction<dim>>(
2226  std::vector<double>({0., 0.,
2227 *
2228 -0.2})));
2229 *
2230  break;
2231  }
2232 *
2233  default:
2234  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
2235  }
2236 *
2237  triangulation.refine_global(n_global_refinements);
2238 *
2239  dof_handler.distribute_dofs(fe);
2240 *
2241  euler_operator.reinit(mapping, dof_handler);
2242  euler_operator.initialize_vector(solution);
2243 *
2244  std::locale s = pcout.get_stream().getloc();
2245  pcout.get_stream().imbue(std::locale(""));
2246  pcout << "Number of degrees of freedom: " << dof_handler.n_dofs()
2247  << " ( = " << (dim + 2) << " [vars] x "
2248  << triangulation.n_global_active_cells() << " [cells] x "
2249  << Utilities::pow(fe_degree + 1, dim) << " [dofs/cell/var] )"
2250  << std::endl;
2251  pcout.get_stream().imbue(s);
2252  }
2253 *
2254 
2255 *
2256  template <int dim>
2257  void EulerProblem<dim>::output_results(const unsigned int result_number)
2258  {
2259  const std::array<double, 3> errors =
2260  euler_operator.compute_errors(ExactSolution<dim>(time), solution);
2261  const std::string quantity_name = testcase == 0 ? "error" : "norm";
2262 *
2263  pcout << "Time:" << std::setw(8) << std::setprecision(3) << time
2264  << ", dt: " << std::setw(8) << std::setprecision(2) << time_step
2265  << ", " << quantity_name << " rho: " << std::setprecision(4)
2266  << std::setw(10) << errors[0] << ", rho u: " << std::setprecision(4)
2267  << std::setw(10) << errors[1] << ", energy:" << std::setprecision(4)
2268  << std::setw(10) << errors[2] << std::endl;
2269 *
2270  {
2271  TimerOutput::Scope t(timer, "output");
2272 *
2273  Postprocessor postprocessor;
2274  DataOut<dim> data_out;
2275 *
2276  DataOutBase::VtkFlags flags;
2277  flags.write_higher_order_cells = true;
2278  data_out.set_flags(flags);
2279 *
2280  data_out.attach_dof_handler(dof_handler);
2281  {
2282  std::vector<std::string> names;
2283  names.emplace_back("density");
2284  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2285  names.emplace_back("momentum");
2286  names.emplace_back("energy");
2287 *
2288  std::vector<DataComponentInterpretation::DataComponentInterpretation>
2289  interpretation;
2290  interpretation.push_back(
2291  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2292  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2293  interpretation.push_back(
2294  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_part_of_vector);
2295  interpretation.push_back(
2296  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2297 *
2298  data_out.add_data_vector(dof_handler, solution, names, interpretation);
2299  }
2300  data_out.add_data_vector(solution, postprocessor);
2301 *
2302  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> reference;
2303  if (testcase == 0 && dim == 2)
2304  {
2305  reference.reinit(solution);
2306  euler_operator.project(ExactSolution<dim>(time), reference);
2307  reference.sadd(-1., 1, solution);
2308  std::vector<std::string> names;
2309  names.emplace_back("error_density");
2310  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2311  names.emplace_back("error_momentum");
2312  names.emplace_back("error_energy");
2313 *
2314  std::vector<DataComponentInterpretation::DataComponentInterpretation>
2315  interpretation;
2316  interpretation.push_back(
2317  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2318  for (unsigned int d = 0; d < dim; ++d)
2319  interpretation.push_back(
2320  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_part_of_vector);
2321  interpretation.push_back(
2322  DataComponentInterpretation::component_is_scalar);
2323 *
2324  data_out.add_data_vector(dof_handler,
2325  reference,
2326  names,
2327  interpretation);
2328  }
2329 *
2330  Vector<double> mpi_owner(triangulation.n_active_cells());
2331  mpi_owner = Utilities::MPI::this_mpi_process(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2332  data_out.add_data_vector(mpi_owner, "owner");
2333 *
2334  data_out.build_patches(mapping,
2335  fe.degree,
2336  DataOut<dim>::curved_inner_cells);
2337 *
2338  const std::string filename =
2339  "solution_" + Utilities::int_to_string(result_number, 3) + ".vtu";
2340  data_out.write_vtu_in_parallel(filename, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2341  }
2342  }
2343 *
2344 
2345 *
2346  template <int dim>
2347  void EulerProblem<dim>::run()
2348  {
2349  {
2350  const unsigned int n_vect_number = VectorizedArrayType::size();
2351  const unsigned int n_vect_bits = 8 sizeof(Number) n_vect_number;
2352 *
2353  pcout << "Running with "
2354  << Utilities::MPI::n_mpi_processes(MPI_COMM_WORLD)
2355  << " MPI processes" << std::endl;
2356  pcout << "Vectorization over " << n_vect_number << " "
2357  << (std::is_same<Number, double>::value ? "doubles" : "floats")
2358  << " = " << n_vect_bits << " bits ("
2359  << Utilities::System::get_current_vectorization_level() << ")"
2360  << std::endl;
2361  }
2362 *
2363  make_grid_and_dofs();
2364 *
2365  const LowStorageRungeKuttaIntegrator integrator(lsrk_scheme);
2366 *
2367  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> rk_register_1;
2368  LinearAlgebra::distributed::Vector<Number> rk_register_2;
2369  rk_register_1.reinit(solution);
2370  rk_register_2.reinit(solution);
2371 *
2372  euler_operator.project(ExactSolution<dim>(time), solution);
2373 *
2374 
2375  double min_vertex_distance = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
2376  for (const auto &cell : triangulation.active_cell_iterators())
2377  if (cell->is_locally_owned())
2378  min_vertex_distance =
2379  std::min(min_vertex_distance, cell->minimum_vertex_distance());
2380  min_vertex_distance =
2381  Utilities::MPI::min(min_vertex_distance, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2382 *
2383  time_step = courant_number integrator.n_stages() /
2384  euler_operator.compute_cell_transport_speed(solution);
2385  pcout << "Time step size: " << time_step
2386  << ", minimal h: " << min_vertex_distance
2387  << ", initial transport scaling: "
2388  << 1. / euler_operator.compute_cell_transport_speed(solution)
2389  << std::endl
2390  << std::endl;
2391 *
2392  output_results(0);
2393 *
2394  unsigned int timestep_number = 0;
2395 *
2396  while (time < final_time
2397 *
2398 - 1e-12 && timestep_number < max_time_steps)
2399  {
2400  ++timestep_number;
2401  if (timestep_number % 5 == 0)
2402  time_step =
2403  courant_number integrator.n_stages() /
2404  Utilities::truncate_to_n_digits(
2405  euler_operator.compute_cell_transport_speed(solution), 3);
2406 *
2407  {
2408  TimerOutput::Scope t(timer, "rk time stepping total");
2409  integrator.perform_time_step(euler_operator,
2410  time,
2411  time_step,
2412  solution,
2413  rk_register_1,
2414  rk_register_2);
2415  }
2416 *
2417  time += time_step;
2418 *
2419  if (static_cast<int>(time / output_tick) !=
2420  static_cast<int>((time
2421 *
2422 - time_step) / output_tick) ||
2423  time >= final_time
2424 *
2425 - 1e-12)
2426  output_results(
2427  static_cast<unsigned int>(std::round(time / output_tick)));
2428  }
2429 *
2430  timer.print_wall_time_statistics(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2431  pcout << std::endl;
2432  }
2433 *
2434  } // namespace Euler_DG
2435 *
2436 
2437  int main(int argc, char*argv)
2438  {
2439  using namespace Euler_DG;
2440  using namespace dealii;
2441 *
2442  Utilities::MPI::MPI_InitFinalize mpi_initialization(argc, argv, 1);
2443 *
2444  try
2445  {
2446  deallog.depth_console(0);
2447 *
2448  EulerProblem<dimension> euler_problem;
2449  euler_problem.run();
2450  }
2451  catch (std::exception &exc)
2452  {
2453  std::cerr << std::endl
2454  << std::endl
2455  << "----------------------------------------------------"
2456  << std::endl;
2457  std::cerr << "Exception on processing: " << std::endl
2458  << exc.what() << std::endl
2459  << "Aborting!" << std::endl
2460  << "----------------------------------------------------"
2461  << std::endl;
2462 *
2463  return 1;
2464  }
2465  catch (...)
2466  {
2467  std::cerr << std::endl
2468  << std::endl
2469  << "----------------------------------------------------"
2470  << std::endl;
2471  std::cerr << "Unknown exception!" << std::endl
2472  << "Aborting!" << std::endl
2473  << "----------------------------------------------------"
2474  << std::endl;
2475  return 1;
2476  }
2477 *
2478  return 0;
2479  }
2480  @endcode
2481 * <a name="Results"></a><h1>Results</h1>
2482 *
2483 
2484 * Running the program with the default settings on a machine with 40 processesproduces the following output:
2485 * @code
2486 Running with 40 MPI processes
2487 Vectorization over 8 doubles = 512 bits (AVX512)
2488 Number of degrees of freedom: 27.648.000 ( = 5 [vars] x 25.600 [cells] x 216 [dofs/cell/var] )
2489 Time step size: 0.000295952, minimal h: 0.0075, initial transport scaling: 0.00441179
2490 Time: 0, dt: 0.0003, norm rho: 5.385e-16, rho u: 1.916e-16, energy: 1.547e-15
2491 +--------------------------------------+------------------+------------+------------------+
2492 | Total wallclock time elapsed | 17.52s 10 | 17.52s | 17.52s 11 |
2493 | | | |
2494 | Section | no. calls | min time rank | avg time | max time rank |
2495 +--------------------------------------+------------------+------------+------------------+
2496 | compute errors | 1 | 0.009594s 16 | 0.009705s | 0.009819s 8 |
2497 | compute transport speed | 22 | 0.1366s 0 | 0.1367s | 0.1368s 18 |
2498 | output | 1 | 1.233s 0 | 1.233s | 1.233s 32 |
2499 | rk time stepping total | 100 | 8.746s 35 | 8.746s | 8.746s 0 |
2500 | rk_stage
2501 *
2502 - integrals L_h | 500 | 8.742s 36 | 8.742s | 8.743s 2 |
2503 +--------------------------------------+------------------+------------+------------------+
2504 @endcode
2505 *
2506 * and the following visual output:
2507 * <table align="center" class="doxtable" style="width:85%">
2508  <tr>
2509  <td>
2510  <img src="https://www.dealii.org/images/steps/developer/step-67.pressure_010.png" alt="" width="100%">
2511  </td>
2512  <td>
2513  <img src="https://www.dealii.org/images/steps/developer/step-67.pressure_025.png" alt="" width="100%">
2514  </td>
2515  </tr>
2516  <tr>
2517  <td>
2518  <img src="https://www.dealii.org/images/steps/developer/step-67.pressure_050.png" alt="" width="100%">
2519  </td>
2520  <td>
2521  <img src="https://www.dealii.org/images/steps/developer/step-67.pressure_100.png" alt="" width="100%">
2522  </td>
2523  </tr>
2524 </table>
2525 * As a reference, the results of @ref step_67 "step-67" using FCL are:
2526 * @code
2527 Running with 40 MPI processes
2528 Vectorization over 8 doubles = 512 bits (AVX512)
2529 Number of degrees of freedom: 27.648.000 ( = 5 [vars] x 25.600 [cells] x 216 [dofs/cell/var] )
2530 Time step size: 0.000295952, minimal h: 0.0075, initial transport scaling: 0.00441179
2531 Time: 0, dt: 0.0003, norm rho: 5.385e-16, rho u: 1.916e-16, energy: 1.547e-15
2532 +-------------------------------------------+------------------+------------+------------------+
2533 | Total wallclock time elapsed | 13.33s 0 | 13.34s | 13.35s 34 |
2534 | | | |
2535 | Section | no. calls | min time rank | avg time | max time rank |
2536 +-------------------------------------------+------------------+------------+------------------+
2537 | compute errors | 1 | 0.007977s 10 | 0.008053s | 0.008161s 30 |
2538 | compute transport speed | 22 | 0.1228s 34 | 0.2227s | 0.3845s 0 |
2539 | output | 1 | 1.255s 3 | 1.257s | 1.259s 27 |
2540 | rk time stepping total | 100 | 11.15s 0 | 11.32s | 11.42s 34 |
2541 | rk_stage
2542 *
2543 - integrals L_h | 500 | 8.719s 10 | 8.932s | 9.196s 0 |
2544 | rk_stage
2545 *
2546 - inv mass + vec upd | 500 | 1.944s 0 | 2.377s | 2.55s 10 |
2547 +-------------------------------------------+------------------+------------+------------------+
2548 @endcode
2549 *
2550 * By the modifications shown in this tutorial, we were able to achieve a speedup of27% for the Runge-Kutta stages.
2551 * <a name="Possibilitiesforextensions"></a><h3>Possibilities for extensions</h3>
2552 *
2553 
2554 * The algorithms are easily extendable to higher dimensions: a high-dimensional<a href="https://github.com/hyperdeal/hyperdeal/blob/a9e67b4e625ff1dde2fed93ad91cdfacfaa3acdf/include/hyper.deal/operators/advection/advection_operation.h#L219-L569">advection operator based on cell-centric loops</a>is part of the hyper.deal library. An extension of cell-centric loopsto locally-refined meshes is more involved.
2555 * <a name="ExtensiontothecompressibleNavierStokesequations"></a><h4>Extension to the compressible Navier-Stokes equations</h4>
2556 *
2557 
2558 * The solver presented in this tutorial program can also be extended to thecompressible NavierStokes equations by adding viscous terms, as alsosuggested in @ref step_67 "step-67" . To keep as much of the performance obtained here despitethe additional cost of elliptic terms, e.g. via an interior penalty method, thattutorial has proposed to switch the basis from FE_DGQ to FE_DGQHermite like inthe @ref step_59 "step-59" tutorial program. The reasoning behind this switch is that in thecase of FE_DGQ all values of neighboring cells (i.e., @f$k+1@f$ layers) are needed,whilst in the case of FE_DGQHermite only 2 layers, making the lattersignificantly more suitable for higher degrees. The additional layers have to be,on the one hand, loaded from main memory during flux computation and, one theother hand, have to be communicated. Using the shared-memory capabilitiesintroduced in this tutorial, the second point can be eliminated on a singlecompute node or its influence can be reduced in a hybrid context.
2559 * <a name="BlockGaussSeidellikepreconditioners"></a><h4>Block Gauss-Seidel-like preconditioners</h4>
2560 *
2561 
2562 * Cell-centric loops could be used to create block Gauss-Seidel preconditionersthat are multiplicative within one process and additive over processes. Thesetype of preconditioners use during flux computation, in contrast to Jacobi-typepreconditioners, already updated values from neighboring cells. The followingpseudo-code visualizes how this could in principal be achieved:
2563 * @code
2564 *
2565 Vector<Number> visit_flags(data.n_cell_batches () + data.n_ghost_cell_batches ());
2566 *
2567 
2568 
2569 *
2570 data.template loop_cell_centric<VectorType, VectorType>(
2571  [&](const auto &data, auto &dst, const auto &src, const auto cell_range) {
2572 *
2573  for (unsigned int cell = cell_range.first; cell < cell_range.second; ++cell)
2574  {
2575  // cell integral as usual (not shown)
2576 *
2577  for (unsigned int face = 0; face < GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell; ++face)
2578  {
2579  const auto boundary_id = data.get_faces_by_cells_boundary_id(cell, face)[0];
2580 *
2581  if (boundary_id == numbers::internal_face_boundary_id)
2582  {
2583  phi_p.reinit(cell, face);
2584 *
2585  const auto flags = phi_p.read_cell_data(visit_flags);
2586  const auto all_neighbors_have_been_updated =
2587  std::min(flags.begin(),
2588  flags().begin() + data.n_active_entries_per_cell_batch(cell) == 1;
2589 *
2590  if(all_neighbors_have_been_updated)
2591  phi_p.gather_evaluate(dst, EvaluationFlags::values);
2592  else
2593  phi_p.gather_evaluate(src, EvaluationFlags::values);
2594 *
2595  // continue as usual (not shown)
2596  }
2597  else
2598  {
2599  // boundary integral as usual (not shown)
2600  }
2601  }
2602 *
2603  // continue as above and apply your favorite algorithm to invert
2604  // the cell-local operator (not shown)
2605 *
2606  // make cells as updated
2607  phi.set_cell_data(visit_flags, VectorizedArrayType(1.0));
2608  }
2609  },
2610  dst,
2611  src,
2612  true,
2613  MatrixFree<dim, Number, VectorizedArrayType>::DataAccessOnFaces::values);
2614 @endcode
2615 *
2616 * For this purpose, one can exploit the cell-data vector capabilities ofMatrixFree and the range-based iteration capabilities of VectorizedArray.
2617 * Please note that in the given example we process <code>VectorizedArrayType::size()</code> number of blocks, since each lane corresponds to one block. We consider blocksas updated if all blocks processed by a vector register have been updated. Inthe case of Cartesian meshes this is a reasonable approach, however, forgeneral unstructured meshes this conservative approach might lead to a decrease in theefficiency of the preconditioner. A reduction of cells processed in parallelby explicitly reducing the number of lanes used by <code>VectorizedArrayType</code> might increase the quality of the preconditioner, but with the cost that eachiteration might be more expensive. This dilemma leads us to a further"possibility for extension": vectorization within an element.
2618 *
2619 
2620 * <a name="PlainProg"></a><h1> The plain program</h1> @include "step-76.cc"
2621 * */
possible
if you have code where no sensible default value for a parameter is possible

constexpr EulerNumericalFlux numerical_flux_type

this holds in if the matrix is actually distributed across a cluster of computers If you want to use PETSc Trilinos you can either copy an already condensed deal II or assemble the PETSc Trilinos matrix in the already condensed see the discussion below ***Condensing vectors works exactly as described above for matrices Note that condensation is an idempotent operation
Definition: constraints_0.txt:73
Utilities::pow

Definition: utilities.h:464
i
namespace in which classes relating to the description of d polynomial spaces are declared ***Base class for all D polynomials A polynomial is represented in this class by its coefficients which are set through the constructor or by derived classes There are two paths for evaluation of polynomials One is based on the coefficients which are evaluated through the Horner scheme which is a robust general purpose scheme An alternative and more stable evaluation of high degree polynomials with roots in the unit interval is provided by a product in terms of the roots This form is available for special polynomials such as Lagrange polynomials or Legendre polynomials and used with the respective constructor To obtain this more stable evaluation form the constructor with the roots in form of a Lagrange polynomial must be used In case a manipulation is done that changes the roots the representation is switched to the coefficient form This class is a typical example of a possible template argument for the TensorProductPolynomials class **Constructor The coefficients of the polynomial are passed as and denote the i e the first element of the array denotes the constant the second the linear and so on The degree of the polynomial represented by this object is thus the number of elements in the< tt > coefficient</tt > array minus one **Constructor creating a zero polynomial of degree *[2.x.3] *Constructor for a Lagrange polynomial and its point of evaluation The idea is to where j is the evaluation point specified as argument and the support points contain all the evaluation is based on products of the whereas the Horner scheme is used for polynomials in the coefficient form **Return the values and the derivatives of the Polynomial at point< tt > x</tt >< tt > i
Definition: polynomial_0.txt:24

********clusters ***deal II can use multiple machines connected via MPI to parallelize in addition to the parallelization within a shared memory machine discussed in the[2.x.4] module There are essentially two ways to utilize multiple but only a share of the global sparsity and solution vector is stored on each machine ****The mesh and DoF handler are also i e each processor stores only a share of the cells and degrees of freedom No processor has knowledge of the entire or and in fact problems solved in this mode are usually so and handling distributed vectors
Definition: distributed_0.txt:26

***deal II s[2.x.1] tutorial contains a set of programs that togetherform the geodynamics demonstration suite The idea of these programs is todemonstrate techniques for advanced finite element software usingapplications from i e the investigation of processes in thesolid earth By doing these programs are supposed to provide a basisfor more dedicated programs that can solve actual for example as part of the work of graduate students orpostdocs A more thorough discussion of the motivation for these programsfollows below * Currently
